DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective study test whether fluid resuscitation protocol guide non-invasive hemodynamic measure reduce progression organ dysfunction ( defined increase Serial Organ Failure Assessment Score ≥ 1 first 72 hour ) sepsis patient present Emergency Department without evidence shock .
DOC.brief_title: Cardiac Output Monitoring Managing Intravenous Therapy ( COMMIT ) Treat Emergency Department Severe Sepsis
DOC.criteria: 1 . Adult patient > 18 year old suspect confirmed infection 2 . At least two follow four criterion ( SIRS ) : 1 . Temperature > 38 < 36o C 2 . Heart rate > 90 bpm 3 . Respiratory rate > 20 bpm PaCO2 < 32 mmHg 4 . White blood cell count > 12,000 < 4,000 per mm3 ; > 10 % bandemia 3 . Lactate ≥2.0 ≤4.0 mMol/L 4 . Enrollment within 6 hour ED presentation within 2.5 hour meet eligibility criterion 1 . Age < 18 year 2 . On vasopressor therapy 3 . Systolic blood pressure < 90 mmHg 4 . Received 3liter crystalloid fluid prior randomization 5 . Patient present pulmonary edema 6 . Patient present acute coronary syndrome 7 . Patient present new onset cardiac arrhythmia 8 . Patient present trauma , include burn 9 . Patient require immediate surgery 10 . Patient present stroke 11 . Patient end stage renal disease renal replacement therapy 12 . Patient known pregnancy 13 . Patient treat immunosuppressive therapy organ transplant
